1710666 THE DELHI (DELEGATION OF POWERS) ACT, 1964
ACT NO. 23 OF 1964 [ 16th June, 1964]
All Act to provide for the delegation of certain powers vested in the Administrator of the Union territory of Delhi.
BE it enacted by Parliament in the Fifteenth Year of the Republic of India as follows:-
874942 1 Short title and extent.
914418 1This Act may be called the Delhi (Delegation of Powers) Act, 1964.
652311 2It extends to the whole of the Union territory of Delhi.
967663 2 Definitions. In this Act, unless the context otherwise requires,-
115020 a" Administrator" means the Administrator of Delhi appointed by the President under article 239 of the Constitution;
627045 b" Chief Secretary" means the Chief Secretary of the Delhi Administration;
475437 c" Delhi" means the Union territory of Delhi;
567129 d" District Judge" means the District Judge, Delhi, and includes an Additional District Judge, Delhi.
193667 3 Delegation of powers, etc., vested in Administrator under certain laws.
1897377 1Any power, authority or jurisdiction or any duty which the Administrator may exercise or discharge by or under the pro- visions of any enactment mentioned in column 1 of the Schedule may be exercised or discharged also-
1025564 aby any officer or authority mentioned in relation thereto in column 2 of the said Schedule;
1495189 bby such other officer or authority as may be specified in this behalf by the Central Government by notification in the Official Gazette.
1383423 2The Administrator may transfer any appeal or application for revision or any other matter pending before him for disposal to an officer or other authority competent under sub- section (1) to dispose of the same.
